page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: The worst problem in the area is that of the A26 through Southborough, which is badly congested in the morning and evening rush hours and at many other timesof the day. There is no easy way of by-passing this narrow road which does carry much heavy lorry traffic as well as cars and buses. Pedestrian crossings in the shopping area and a major T-junction add to the slowing of the traffic flow. Another rush hour snarl-up occurs in High Brooms when traffic to or from the neighbouring industrial estate has to pass under the railway on a single track road with traffic lights. High Brooms station is on the London to Hastings line and has recently been lengthened to take the new 12-coach electric trains which will shortly be running on this line. The section south of Tonbridge is being electrified.
